title: How to Set Up a Portable Field Light Tower

steps.headline: Know that manufacturing companies understand!
steps.description: Light tower manufacturing and distribution companies completely know the importance of setting up and getting the portable field light tower in working order as quickly as possible. They also understand that not all companies will have the resources to set up a light tower. For this reason, most light tower companies provide a complete manual that not only provides all the parts and specifications, but also a step-by-step setup process.

steps.headline: When you receive your portable field light tower, you will find the following components:
steps.description: Wheeled trailer with a tongue jack and locking pins An engine and a generator set within the trailer for power Light mast with lock bar and winches Junction box connecting flood lights and mast Flood lamps, which are already attached to the mast 4 jack handles on trailer Safety and locking pins and outriggers already present within the trailer and the mast

steps.headline: Before you begin the assembly of the light tower, it is better to keep the following points in mind:
steps.description:
Choose a location that is free from overhead wires so that there won’t be any tangling with the mast. Set the light tower up at a place with firm and flat earthen ground for better installation and usage
When raising the mast, make sure it is higher than the general lights that may already be present on the ground. Bring the light tower to the location and make sure it is level
Block the wheels of the trailer to keep it from moving during installation.

steps.headline: Pull the tongue jack locking pin in an upwards motion and then twist to a 90 degree angle.
steps.description: The twisting will snap the spring loaded pins into place.

steps.headline: Turning the jack handle in a clockwise direction, raise the trailer off from the towing vehicle.
On the trailer outriggers, snap the spring loaded pins into place by pulling on the locking pins and rotating them at a 90 degree angle
steps.description: Repeat the previous step for the locking pins on the rear jack handle.

steps.headline: To level the trailer, turn the jack handle in a clockwise direction.
Repeat the last step with the other 3 jack handles to root the trailer level on the ground
Adjust the lamps to your requirement by loosening the wing bolts on the lamp fixture.
Firmly connect the lamps to the junction box by tightening all hardware
Remove the locking pin from the mast cradle.
steps.description: Check mast cables, electrical cords, and cable pulleys for any damage.

steps.headline: Remove the safety pin out from the lock bar of the mast.
Use the lower mast winch handle to raise the mast to a vertical position.
steps.description: Secure the mast lock with the safety pin.

steps.headline: Use the upper mast winch to raise the tower to the desired height.
Make sure that all cables and wires are moving smoothly.

text:
Before You Begin Know that manufacturing companies understand! Light tower manufacturing and distribution companies completely know the importance of setting up and getting the portable field light tower in working order as quickly as possible. They also understand that not all companies will have the resources to set up a light tower. For this reason, most light tower companies provide a complete manual that not only provides all the parts and specifications, but also a step-by-step setup process. When you receive your portable field light tower, you will find the following components: Wheeled trailer with a tongue jack and locking pins An engine and a generator set within the trailer for power Light mast with lock bar and winches Junction box connecting flood lights and mast Flood lamps, which are already attached to the mast 4 jack handles on trailer Safety and locking pins and outriggers already present within the trailer and the mast Before you begin the assembly of the light tower, it is better to keep the following points in mind: Choose a location that is free from overhead wires so that there won’t be any tangling with the mast. Set the light tower up at a place with firm and flat earthen ground for better installation and usage
When raising the mast, make sure it is higher than the general lights that may already be present on the ground. Bring the light tower to the location and make sure it is level
Block the wheels of the trailer to keep it from moving during installation. Setup Pull the tongue jack locking pin in an upwards motion and then twist to a 90 degree angle. The twisting will snap the spring loaded pins into place. Turning the jack handle in a clockwise direction, raise the trailer off from the towing vehicle.  On the trailer outriggers, snap the spring loaded pins into place by pulling on the locking pins and rotating them at a 90 degree angle Repeat the previous step for the locking pins on the rear jack handle. To level the trailer, turn the jack handle in a clockwise direction.  Repeat the last step with the other 3 jack handles to root the trailer level on the ground  Adjust the lamps to your requirement by loosening the wing bolts on the lamp fixture.  Firmly connect the lamps to the junction box by tightening all hardware  Raising the Tower Remove the locking pin from the mast cradle. Check mast cables, electrical cords, and cable pulleys for any damage. Remove the safety pin out from the lock bar of the mast.  Use the lower mast winch handle to raise the mast to a vertical position. Secure the mast lock with the safety pin. Use the upper mast winch to raise the tower to the desired height.  Make sure that all cables and wires are moving smoothly.
